question_content:
>

In the context in which it appears, "transparent" most nearly means

fragile

translucent

patent

brittle

relevant

patent.

A transparent violation of the Second Amendment would be a violation that was obvious or easily detected. In other words, it would be a patent (readily evident) violation of the law.

Fragile is incorrect. Fragile (easily broken) is inappropriate in this context.

Translucent is incorrect. Translucent (permitting light to pass through in a diffused fashion) is inappropriate in this context.

Brittle is incorrect. Brittle (hard and rigid, but breakable) is inappropriate in this context.

Relevant is incorrect. Relevant (pertinent; applicable) is inappropriate in this context.
